dc_title_s: The Congo River from Stanley Pool to Bangala surveyed by George Grenfell and T. J. Comber 1884
dc_description_s: Includes inset: Stanley Pool, surveyed by G. Grenfell and T. J. Comber 1884 [scale ca. 1:440,800]. Sand banks and shoals in pool are shown. Villages and vegetation along riverbanks are shown. Presence of International African Association, Livingstone Inland Mission, and Baptist Missions in villages is indicated. Course of Bochini or Kwa [lower Kasai] River and its junction with Congo are shown. Relief shown by hachures, spot heights, and text. "The Longitude depends on Mr. [Henry Morton] Stanley's Position of Leopoldville." From: Proceedings of the Royal Geographical Society and monthly record of geography. Vol. 7 (1885), no. 6, pp. 353-73; held in Firestone Library. Call number: G7 .J6873
